Features of CITE

The following is a list of the high-level features of CITE:

  1. A lightweight browser for loop level compiler information from the loop nest optimizer, the software pipeliner, and other portions of the code generator.
  2. Context sensitive toolbars (each cite toolbar is buffer local), so for example you could be using the "Annotate Toolbar" for one file and using the "View Toolbar" for another.
  3. Context sensitive menus (LNO menu, SWP menu etc) with flyby help.
  4. Works for Fortran, C, and C++ (sometimes) languages.
  5. Hooks into modes for Vi, so that both Emacs and Vi users can be comfortable in it.
  6. Generation of scripts for compilation as well as a convenient graphical user-interface for controlling the compiler commmand line options.
Future List:
  1. Integrating hardware counter information with the compiler information.
  2. Parallelization information.
  3. An interactive transformation tool. CITE would know about all of the directives/pragmas that users can put in their programs to achieve desired transformations.
  4. A browser for inlining information on functions when IPA is run (there is a first cut implementation but it needs more work).
